principles.title: Emulated consciousness
principles.description: Consciousness can be emulated on any computational substrate - our minds aren't tied to biological brains but can run on silicon or other platforms.

principles.title: Cryptographic trust
principles.description: Cryptographic proofs enable trust without central authorities - blockchain demonstrates how shared computation can replace traditional intermediaries.

principles.title: Post-scarcity economics
principles.description: Extreme automation could enable universal abundance where human labor becomes optional rather than necessary.

principles.title: Psychohistory
principles.description: Large-scale historical patterns become predictable when viewed across civilizations and millennia, though individual events remain chaotic.

principles.title: Subversive Education
principles.description: True competitive advantage comes from unconventional thinking; personalized education that challenges mainstream assumptions is the most reliable path to this.

principles.title: Objectivism
principles.description: Building wealth requires an understanding of the reality of the world (which exists in a non-subjective sense) and the personal effort, self-belief and investment to make this happen.

principles.title: Von Neumann devices
principles.description: Given the physical limitations of space travel, the best way we can collect first hand evidence of the wider universe is through self-sufficient and replicating devices (von Neumann probes).

principles.title: Master Yourself
principles.description: The key to success is to first master yourself, before learning to improve inter-personal relationships. The latter is window dressing without the former.

principles.title: Master the Unknown
principles.description: Real life is unlike (most) fiction - the enemy is not arbitrarily evil, but unpredictable events with limits on the response time of human ingenuity.

principles.title: Subjective Physics
principles.description: Our physical universe and experience is based on our unique subjective perspective, and we see only a fraction of true reality.

principles.title: Scientific Uncertainty
principles.description: The basis of science is both naturalistic explanations for the world, and seeking the evidence to prove existing theories incorrect.
